org.sd.text
Class DetailedUrl

java.lang.Object
  org.sd.text.DetailedUrl

public class DetailedUrl
extends java.lang.Object

Utility wrapper around a url that gives detailed access to its pieces.

Where detailed pieces are:

(for http://www.semanticdiscovery.com:8080/foo/bar/baz.html?a=b#anchor1)

  • protocol -- i.e. http://
  • hostPrefix -- i.e. www.
  • host -- i.e. semanticdiscovery.com
  • port -- i.e. :8080
  • path -- i.e. /foo/bar/
  • target -- i.e. baz
  • targetExtension -- i.e. .html
  • query -- i.e. ?a=b
  • anchor -- i.e. #anchor1

Author:
Spence Koehler

cleanup

Cleanup a url string by:
  • Removing whitespace, single and double quotes, and less than/greater than signs.

cleanupHost

public static final java.lang.String cleanupHost(java.lang.String host)
Assuming a string with just the "host", clean off any extra chars at the end.

Note: currently, we strip off any "-JUNK" at the end, where the dash occurs after the last dot.

getProtocol

public java.lang.String getProtocol(boolean normalized)
Get the protocol portion of this url.

For example, "http://", "file://", "https://", "ftp://", "news:"

If normalized, lowercase and replace backslashes with forward slashes.

getHostPrefix

public java.lang.String getHostPrefix(boolean normalized)
Get the host prefix portion of the host (with trailing '.'), if recognized.

For example, "www.", "www1.", "web.", "web1.", etc.

If normalized, lowercase.

getHost

public java.lang.String getHost(boolean normalized,
                                boolean withHostPrefix,
                                boolean withPortIfPresent)
Get the host with or without the host prefix and/or port.

If normalized, lowercase.

getPostPrefixHostIndex

public int getPostPrefixHostIndex()
Get the index of the start of the host after the host prefix.

getPort

public java.lang.String getPort()
Get the port (if present) with its preceding colon (':') or an empty string.

getPath

public java.lang.String getPath(boolean withoutTargetOrExtension)
Get the path part of this url optionally without the target or extension.

The path (when non-empty) always has its preceding slash and, when retrieved without its target or extension, will have its trailing slash.

Returns:
the path or an empty string if not present.

getTarget

public java.lang.String getTarget(boolean withTargetExtension)
Get the target (optionally with its extension).

The target is the final (pathless) filename referenced by the url without a preceding slash.

getTargetExtension

public java.lang.String getTargetExtension(boolean normalized)
Get the extension of the url's target.

For example, ".htm", ".html", ".txt", ".jsp", etc.

getQuery

public java.lang.String getQuery()
Get the query portion of the url.

Get the query portion of the url.

fixHref

public java.lang.String fixHref(java.lang.String href)
Combine this url as a base or reference path with the given href path to create a normalized absolute path.

NOTE that multiple consecutive "/" symbols in the path are treated as a single path delimiter instead of as redirection of the path to root.

fixHref

public java.lang.String fixHref(DetailedUrl href)
Combine this url as a base or reference path with the given href path to create a normalized absolute path.

NOTE that multiple consecutive "/" symbols in the path are treated as a single path delimiter instead of as redirection of the path to root.

getOriginal

public java.lang.String getOriginal()
Get the original (input) url used to construct this instance.

public java.lang.String toString()
Get this url as a string.

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
the fully normalized url.

splitHostExtensions

public final java.lang.String[] splitHostExtensions(boolean normalized)
Split host (locator) extensions from the host (like ".co.uk" or ".gov"), returning {host, extensions}.

For example: for "www.foo.co.uk", return {"foo", "co.uk"}.

doHostExtensionsSplit

public static java.lang.String[] doHostExtensionsSplit(java.lang.String host)
Auxiliary method to split extensions from the host (like ".co.uk" or ".gov"), returning {host, extensiosn}.

getDomainNameWords

public java.lang.String[] getDomainNameWords(boolean normalized)

getUrlPathWords

public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getUrlPathWords()

extractUrls

public final java.util.Set<DetailedUrl> extractUrls(java.lang.String text,
                                                    boolean discardInternal)
Extract (unique) url strings from the text.

Note that this searches the text for the pattern https?:// to find and extract all urls, accounting for delimiters likely to be found in html text.

extractUrls

public final boolean extractUrls(java.lang.String text,
                                 java.util.Set<DetailedUrl> result,
                                 boolean discardInternal)
Extract (unique) url strings from the text into the given result.

Note that this searches the text for the pattern https?:// to find and extract all urls, accounting for delimiters likely to be found in html text.

public static final void main(java.lang.String[] args)
